title: (x) Wired Magazine tech sans cover type - Blender {Stephen}
content:
I’m going crazy trying to find the exact font of the Wired Magazine September 2006 issue. I know this file is too small, but it’s the only one I could find, and hoping someone knows the issue. Thanks. Kristofer

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sm14.09.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/typophile.com/files/sm14.09.jpg) | 4.43 KB |

 [‹ Chipita Germany GmbH tech sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29111 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) First Republic Bank serif face - Adobe Garamond {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29102 "Go to next forum topic")
author: copper

comments.content: I’ve got a copy of that issue of Wired. I didn’t recognize the face, but it’s more geometric than DIN — sort of a cross between DIN, Gridnik, and Stratum.

[Carplates](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/www.fontworks2.type.co.uk/fw/shop/catalog?action=zoom&rt=007062000&x=0&y=0&s=sf%3A*%3Bqa%3Acarplates%3Bf%3A*%3Bp%3A0%3Bq%3AquickSearch%3B)?  
 [Register](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=register)?  
 [FF Oxide](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=FF%20Oxide) is not it, but a nice all-caps option.

Here’s an image. There’s a Gridnik-like spur on the G that’s hard to see.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144313im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/wired_type_6395.jpg)
Yes, blender! Thank you so much. Awesome.
